author: wadalliance
title: Grow Africa, Grow Cardano
description: How do we prepare Africa for a future of wide-scale Cardano adoption? How do we continue to seed and grow adoption in 2022 and beyond?

f6_assessments.q0: For me the alignment of this challenge and the criticality to achieve Cardano's mission is clear, Africa has been at the center of the efforts of the community and IOG for a long time, I personally totally agree because it is a An area that not only has impressive financial potential but also Cardano has the ability to change the lives of a sector of the population that has historically been neglected. However, I must say that after doing a quick and non-exhaustive search of the proposals that are choosing to be challenges for fund 9, I found 9 with characteristics similar to this one (specific challenges for development and growth in an area of ​​the world) I personally believe that as a community we should find a common site where the proposals that seek the development and growth of emerging economies compete under the same challenge, since although they are aimed at a specific area they have much more in common from my point of view. . So I neither agree nor disagree about the Alignment.
f6_assessments.q1: Este reto ha sido pilar dentro de Catalyst desde ya varios fondos, y como resultado cada vemos más participación de miembros de la comunidad de esa zona, más pools provenientes y grandes proyectos de calidad gestados en ese continente. Por lo que por supuesto que estoy de acuerdo que la comunidad está en la capacidad de responder a este reto, además de contar con un challenge team con presencia importante de la comunidad.
f6_assessments.q2: The success criterion seems to me to be very well defined, but I consider it to be very long-term and therefore very difficult to measure. Regarding the metrics, there is a combination of metrics that give an indication of the performance of the challenge itself, and others aimed at being a reference model for future proposals to be contained within this challenge and I am satisfied with this. However, I must add that considering that this challenge has already had several funds as part of the resident challenges at Catalyst, it would be interesting if the team that prepared the proposal presented data that validates that we are on the right path and identifies GAPs that must be addressed.

f6_assessments.q0: The grow Africa, grow Cardano is a good initiative for creating awareness and educating the youth, business personnel and developers on the benefits and technical know-how of the blockchain technology and the project catalyst. The proposals presented for this challenge meets the objectives of the challenge hence it should be included in the next funding cycle to gain a much bigger platform to achieve the goal.
f6_assessments.q1: As it is a good medium for reaching out to many Cardano communities, I believe this challenge has the capacity to bring many great ideas on board for adopting the Cardano Ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics for measuring the success of this challenge are clearly stated and can be very well understood and implemented.

f6_assessments.q0: This challenge has been a staple in several funding rounds and as it mentions Africa has been a major focus for growth and adoption in Cardano's mission. The challenge could emphasize more turning Cardano into an open source project as per the Fund 9 strategic goal although open source projects are not denied under the challenge. The rest of the Fund 9 strategic goals are fully met in the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The community has submitted a significant number of proposals in every funding round that this challenge has been funded relative to the size of the fund. The doubling of the size of the fund this round from last is in line with the participation rate. The challenge mentions that African funding is "almost negligible compared to those from western and developed economies". A quick look at the graph provided revealed that African funding was approximately 10% of the total which is indeed much less than the western societies. Africa makes up approximately 16% of the global population so an increase in funding can be reasonably argued.
f6_assessments.q2: The success criteria of "Practical innovations offered on tackling the unique challenges faced by the continent. A clear roadmap that points to increased adoption." aligns very well with the challenge question of "How do we prepare Africa for a future of wide-scale Cardano adoption? How do we continue to seed and grow adoption in 2022 and beyond?" The key metrics map nicely to the success criteria in that they clearly quantify how to measure progress in addressing the challenge.

f6_assessments.q0:
I encourage proposals like this, allowing Cardano to grow in Africa has a huge potential impact on the community and ecosystem. When we look at the track record of this proposal we can see that it has already been present in Catalyst in F5 and F6, In F7 it was not approved for funding. What this tells me is that there was not enough traction on the proposal to get voted for. This brings me to the point that the proposer did his best this round to turn things around and change the briefing and focus from previous rounds. 
However, I still feel the proposal is not hitting the nail on the head with the briefing. Looking at the briefing it makes me feel that the proposers are looking outward towards a global economy and comparing Africa with the rest of the world instead the proposal should be about what has Africa to offer to the rest of the world and give it uniqueness to it. This is why I'm giving alignment a 4.
f6_assessments.q1: I have no doubt that the proposal can be addressed by the community. Looking at F5 and F6 you can see that there is enough sympathy and engagement to help Africa grow. The team behind the proposal is WADA which we all know for there energetic and full-on engagement in Catalyst. I have no doubt this proposal will be addressed as it should and the team behind it will be more than capable of performing a splendid job.
f6_assessments.q2: Success criteria and KPIs are presented and are adequate. The KPIs are more in-line with the proposal this time than the last Fund which gives a good indication that the proposers is active in the community and adapts to the needs of the community.

f6_assessments.q0: I think widespread of cardano adoption in Africa as a continent will help improve,grow and develop Africa in so many ways,being it Education,improved Economies,socialism etc for now and years ahead. This could achieve most of cardano goals/aim/missions.
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal is feasible such that it has provided measures in place to increase the number of proposals to address fundamentals issues of cardano adoptions in Africa, increasing number of proposal solutions offering infrastructure and education concerns, increasing number of Africa based cardano platform users(CAs,VCAs,Yoroi wallets with much stake pools etc),seeding new African partnerships and institutions and also increase the number of African projects.
A clear budgetary has also been provided to manage funds well to ensure a proper/excellent implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: The research findings provided on crypto market in this proposal shows how  powerful Africa continent can grow/develop through cardano,catalyst and blockchain technology.

f6_assessments.q0: Continuing with a proud tradition and frame of mind which has made Africa the main geographical target of Cardano adoption, all geographical Challenges within majority developing-country areas of the world are of the utmost importance for the mass adoption and spread of Cardano. They are the ones that generate the most visible projects for new members, that generate the first approach and most tangible form of onboarding for new emerging-economy members. Having said that, Africa has the characteristics of a high inequality region, with a very large population, high percentage of unbanked people and high engagement with new technologies. This is a region ripe for disruption via the cryptoeconomy, and the use of Cardano-led projects will ensure a predominant market position for Cardano from an early stage, the spread of SPOs, maximization of transaction volume and onboarding of new members.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has a history of engagement with the Community and multiple proposals already submitted, always centered on Africa as a geographic area ripe for Cardano development. The long track record and Catalyst engagement of WADA clearly speaks for itself. It would be interesting to know, for a future iteration, if there are other organizations or team members beyond those within WADA that could make up the Challenge team for this proposed challenge, perhaps with Community members from specific regions of the continent so as to give a more diverse panel conformation to the Challenge Team and enable physical meetups and Community development in different hubs within the continent.
f6_assessments.q2: As with other geograpchical challenges, the proposal centers key metrics around how many proposals are presented, new members and developers onboarded, and how many Dapps/DAOs/services centered on Africa are brought forth and potentially funded by this mechanism. In the different Fund iterations, geographical challenges have usually attracted much attention and a large number of proposals; therefore it would be safe to assume that this new iteration of Grow Africa, Grow Cardano would attract many new proposals. However, it would be interesting to also include as KPIs of the Challenge success the increase in volume of Cardano transactions in the African continent, the increase of SPOs based in the region, amongst others.

importance: We need to look at the fundamentals that are preventing Africa from being a Cardano adoption leader, rather than a perpetual follower.
success: Practical innovations offered on tackling the unique challenges faced by the continent. A clear roadmap that points to increased adoption.
